data.name: Law of sines
data.description:
# Introduction
  Everybody should know the law of sines:

      a        b        с
    —————— = —————— = —————— = 2R
    sin(A)   sin(B)   sin(C)
    
    
  Where `a, b, c` - the lengths of the sides of a triangle, `A` - angle opposite side `a`, `B` - angle opposite side `b`, `C` - angle opposite side `c`, `R` - radius of circumscribed circle.

  ## Task
  Write a function named `law_of_sines`, that takes three arguments: `a` side length, `A` angle, `B` angle and returns `b` and `c` sides lengths (in that order) in immutable array.
  
  ### Rules
  - `a, b, c >= 1`
  - `a + b > c`, `b + c > a`, `a + c > b`
  - `178 >= A, B, C >= 1`
  - `A + B + C = 180`
  - All angles are in degrees
  - All inputs are float type
  - All inputs are valid according to the rules
  
  #### Examples (input --> output)
    3, 60, 60 --> (3, 3)
    3, 45, 45 --> (3, 4.24...)
    
  Results will be tested by approximate equality and format validator, so there will be four tests for one result.
